definition[0]: to cut off the outer layer of something, using a sharp knife
example[0]: Pare the rind from the fruit.
definition[1]: to reduce the amount, number, or size of something as much as you can
example[1]: The firm has not been able to pare costs fast enough to match competitors.
example[2]: The countryâ€™s defences have been pared to the bone  (=reduced as far as possible).
definition[2]: to gradually reduce a number or amount
example[3]: The company has been paring its regional accounting staff.
example[4]: Both companies have pared down their operations in order to survive.
